dt: {bc}to catch hold of and squeeze tightly between two surfaces, edges, or points {bc}{sx|pinch||}, {sx|bite||}
{bc}to sever by or as if by pinching sharply

dt.t: {wi}nipped{/wi} the dead flowers from the plant

dt: {bc}to destroy the growth, progress, or fulfillment of

dt.t: What could have been a sad story about a young star's career {wi}nipped{/wi} in the bud has become a lesson in human resilience.

dt: {bc}to injure or make numb with cold {bc}{sx|chill||}

dt.t: Some feed on insects, others on fish eggs and fry, still others on scraps of fin {wi}nipped{/wi} off neighboring fish …

dt: {bc}to bite or pinch someone or something lightly
{bc}to harm or numb someone or something with cold

dt.t: The icy wind {wi}nipped{/wi} at my nose.
A photographer {wi}nipped{/wi} in and snapped him dead …
One day during a brief stop, one of them … {wi}nipped{/wi} off the train … to purchase an esoteric label of single-malt Scotch for us that The Royal Scotsman bar didn't stock.

et: Middle English {it}nippen{/it}; akin to Middle Dutch {it}nipen{/it} to pinch, Old Norse {it}hnippa{/it} to prod
shortdef: to catch hold of and squeeze tightly between two surfaces, edges, or points : pinch, bite
to sever by or as if by pinching sharply

dt: {bc}the region of a squeezing or crushing device (such as a calender) where the rolls or jaws are closest together

shortdef: a small quantity of liquor : sip; also : a very small bottle of liquor
to take liquor in nips : tipple

dt: {bc}being so close that the lead or advantage shifts rapidly from one opponent to another

shortdef: being so close that the lead or advantage shifts rapidly from one opponent to another

dt: {bc}accidental and usually public exposure of a woman's nipple

dt.t: The Oscars is an elegant event, but even a classy affair couldn't stop an inevitable {wi}nip slip{/wi}.

As most know, Super Bowl coverage in the past has seen its fair share of turmoil. Most infamously, Janet Jackson's legendary {wi}nip-slip{/wi} of 2004 almost cost CBS more than $500,000 in Federal Communications Commission fines.

shortdef: accidental and usually public exposure of a woman's nipple

dt: {bc}a spring from a supine position to a standing position

shortdef: a spring from a supine position to a standing position

dt: {bc}to remove (something) by squeezing it tightly between the fingers or the parts of a tool

dt.t: He {it}nipped off{/it} the bud with his fingers.
She {it}nipped{/it} the dead branches {it}off{/it} with her clippers.

shortdef: to remove (something) by squeezing it tightly between the fingers or the parts of a tool

dt: {bc}to stop (something) immediately so that it does not become a worse problem

dt.t: Inflation will only get worse if the government doesn't do something right now to {it}nip{/it} it {it}in the bud{/it}.

shortdef: to stop (something) immediately so that it does not become a worse problem
